info.title: Godzilla Operational API
info.description: Manage **Godzilla's operations** with this API. From tracking his movements to keeping him fed, this is your go-to toolkit for handling the King of Monsters. *(Tip: If he seems grumpy, he's probably hungry...and yes, he still prefers gorillas.)*

get.description: Retrieve Godzilla's **current stomping grounds**. Use this to track his whereabouts, but don't get too close. Includes a human-readable description for convenience.

example.description: Godzilla is stomping around Tokyo. Again.

post.description: Provide Godzilla with **his next meal**. He'll eat anything, but let's be honest: *he has a thing for gorillas.* üçñ

requestBody.description: Details about the food you're offering Godzilla.

201.description: Godzilla happily munches on the meal.

example.message: Godzilla is satisfied with 2 gorillas. He gives you an approving roar.

example.error: Godzilla threw the salad back at you. He expects meat!

put.description: Use this endpoint to **set Godzilla's mood**. Valid moods include `calm`, `angry`, and `hungry`. *(Spoiler: Angry and hungry are often the same thing for him.)*

requestBody.description: Specify the new mood for Godzilla.

example.message: Godzilla is now calm and enjoying the ocean breeze.

example.error: Mood 'happy' is not supported. Try 'calm', 'angry', or 'hungry'.

delete.summary: Remove a city from Godzilla's destruction list
delete.description: Spare a city from imminent **Godzilla destruction**. Pro tip: Start with your hometown.

parameters.name: city
parameters.description: Name of the city to remove from Godzilla's destruction list.

example.message: New York has been removed from Godzilla's target list. Citizens breathe a sigh of relief.

404.description: City not found on the target list.

example.error: City not on target list. Either it's safe or already destroyed.

foodItem.description: The food item you're feeding to Godzilla. He prefers *meat*.

quantity.description: The quantity of the food item (in metric tons).
